RelatedSentence: Since the dot - com bubble burst in 2000 , the competitive pressures in the wealth industry have mounted to such a degree , he says , that the internal discussions at banks are entirely about assets under management , advisor head count , and shareholder 's return on equity .

RelatedSentence: Today , Black uses his insider knowledge to teach rich folk how to ask the right questions of their wealth managers , how to find the hidden fees and make sure they are n't getting overcharged , and how to find a manager who can genuinely meet their sophisticated financial needs .

RelatedSentence: Over poached char and peekytoe crab , Black regaled me with some of the horror stories that have walked into his office -- how his clients were shoved into banks ' mediocre proprietary products , despite claims of open architecture , and how many were charged premium rates for commodity products .
